intro: Aporosa bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa aporosa, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Aporosa bracteosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
